Tour de Borobudur di Mulai, Peserta akan Tempuh 265 KM
02 Nov 2019, 09:22 by Angling Adhitya Purbaya


Foto: (Angling Adhitya Purbaya/detikcom)

Semarang - Tour de Borobudur kembali di gelar tahun ini. Jarak tempuh yang akan dalui penggowes dalam dua hari ini yaitu 265 kilometer yang dibagi dua kategori.Start dilakukan pagi ini di Kota Lama Semarang dimulai dengan kategori A. Pada kategori A di hari pertama ini jumlah peserta sebanyak 500 orang rutenya menuju alun-alun Kabupaten Demak kemudian Api Abadi Mrapen, lalu ke Balai Kota Salatiga dan finish di De Tjolomadoe Karanganyar.Untuk hari Minggu besok, dari kategori B sejumlah 1.700 pesepeda akan bergabung dengan kategori A dan berangkat dari De Tjolomadu ke Candi Prambanan dan finish di candi Borobudur Magelang.


Foto: (Angling Adhitya Purbaya/detikcom)

"Event kali ini jarak 265 kilometer dengan 3.500 personel kepolisian ikut mengamankan jalannya kegiatan melintasi 11 wilayah di jajaran Polda Jateng," kata Kepala Dinas Kepemudaan, Olahraga, dan Pariwisata Jateng, Sinoeng R Rachmadi, Sabtu (2/11/2019).BACA JUGA: Kemping Mewah di Destinasi Super Prioritas BorobudurSinoeng menyebut event tersebut merupakan salah satu upaya mendongkrak pariwisata di Jawa Tengah. Maka setiap tahun rute yang dilalu berbeda.Sementara itu koordinator Tour de Borobudur 2019, Hendra Dharmanto mengatakan dalam event yang digagas Semarang Bicycle Association (Samba) itu juga mengkampanyekan go green tanpa sampah plastik."Panitia memberikan spot pengambilan minum (water station) di setiap pemberhentian. Snack juga kita bebas kemasan plastik. Kita nanti banyak membuat water station. Jadi konsep go grennya kena, bebas sampah sembari menikmati alam Jawa Tengah," jelas Hendra.Start Tour de Borobudur di mulai dari depan Gereja Blenduk Kota Lama Semarang. Di antara rombongan terlihat juga Gubernur Jawa Tengah, Ganjar Pranowo yang juga dikenal hobi bersepeda dan mengikuti berbagai event. Tour de Borobudur Begins, Participants will take 265 KM
02 Nov 2019, 09:22 by Angling Adhitya Purbaya


Photo: (Angling Adhitya Purbaya / detikcom)

Semarang - Tour de Borobudur returns to the title this year. The mileage that will be passed by the trainers in two days is 265 kilometers divided into two categories. The start of this morning in the Old City of Semarang starts with category A. In category A, on the first day there were 500 participants on their route to the square of Demak Regency then Api Abadi Mrapen, then to Salatiga City Hall and finish at De Tjolomadoe Karanganyar. For Sunday tomorrow, from category B some 1,700 cyclists will join category A and depart from De Tjolomadu to Prambanan Temple and finish at Borobudur Magelang temple.


Photo: (Angling Adhitya Purbaya / detikcom)

"This event is a distance of 265 kilometers with 3,500 police personnel taking part in securing activities across 11 regions in Central Java Regional Police," said the Head of the Department of Youth, Sports and Tourism in Central Java, Sinoeng R Rachmadi, Saturday (2/11/2019). READ ALSO. : Luxury Camping in a Super Priority Destination at Borobudur Sinoeng said that the event was an effort to boost tourism in Central Java. So each year the route is different. Meanwhile, the coordinator of the 2019 de Tour de Borobudur, Hendra Dharmanto said that the event initiated by the Semarang Bicycle Association (Samba) also campaigned for go green without plastic waste. "The committee provides a drinking water spot at each "We will also make a lot of water stations. So the concept of GoGren is hit, free of garbage while enjoying the nature of Central Java," explained Hendra. Tour de Borobudur started in front of Blenduk Church, Kota Lama Semarang. Among the group was also seen the Governor of Central Java, Ganjar Pranowo who is also known for his hobby of cycling and participating in various events.
